sentences: Michael Joseph Nelson, known under the stage name Banners (styled as BANNÎžRS), is an English musician from Liverpool, based in Toronto, Ontario.
He released his debut studio album Where the Shadow Ends in 2019.
Nelson grew up singing in Liverpool Cathedral Choir and performed with the choir in various locations throughout Europe before deciding to start a solo career.
In 2015, he relocated to Toronto, Ontario, Canada, from his native Liverpool, and contacted Canadian producer Stephen Kozmeniuk to work on his sound.
Nelson released his debut single "Ghosts" in March 2015 under the stage name Raines.
His second single, "Shine a Light", was released in August 2015 under the new moniker Banners.
A music video for the song was directed by Christopher Ranson and released in October 2015.
On 4 December, Banners released his third single "Start a Riot".
His debut self-titled EP, produced by Kozmeniuk, was released on 15 January 2016 through Island Records.

On 4 October 2019, Banners released his debut album, Where the Shadow Ends, preceded by the singles "Got It In You" and "Where the Shadow Ends" The album was supported with a five-week headline tour across North America.
In 2020, his 2017 single "Someone to You" received a resurgence in streaming following a TikTok trend.
On 1 May 2020, Banners released his third EP, Always Yours, on Island Records, with acoustic versions of previously released tracks, along with the new title track.
In April 2018, Banners appeared on season 16 of the U.S. TV competition American Idol to perform two duets with contestants Ron Bultongez and Alyssa Raghu.
